channel.description: Recent content in Google on Rukshan's Blog

item.title: Google Search Has To Innovate or Die
item.description: Google when it first came out as a search engine was innovative in so many different aspects from search engines that preceded Google. From better ranking algorithm over simply counting keywords, cleaner UI with no banner ads or popups, rather than trying to keep users on their website Google just provided a better search experience overall.

item.title: The Art of Writing Abstracts
item.description: I have never been interested in academia and research. I always felt research and academia, or a majority of what people publish is just to fill their profiles with the number of publications. When I think about research, I always think about doing research as something groundbreaking. I remember telling colleagues (and I still do) to read the Page Rank algorithm [link, link 2] publication that formed the backbone of Google search in the beginning. I wanted every research or publication to be something like Page Rank.

item.title: Medium and Google is not a good combination
item.description: I know this is going to sound just like another complaint against Google, but I want my Google results to be better.

item.title: Reddit can't build a better search engine
item.description: Every week or twice a week, you will come across a post on HackerNews that Google is dying or Google is awful. There are some valid points to some of their arguments. However, I don’t see Google going anywhere anytime soon.

item.title: Hackers briefly took over the Google.lk domain
item.description: Today hackers were able to briefly take over the Google.lk domain, the Google’s search engine page for Sri Lanka and redirect it to bring awareness to an ongoing crisis in Sri Lanka.

item.title: Would you pay me if I built a web browser?
item.description: Google recently announced their Q4 results, and it seems almost everyone is having a great Q4 from Facebook, to Amazon to Google.

item.title: Why Google needs to build an open chat client like Element
item.description: Google recently blocked the Matrix based chat app Element from the Play Store sighting sexual content on the platform. It’s really hard to define the explanation because WhatsApp, Telegram users of other chat clients also share the same content. Telegram is also known to host groups sharing pirated content as well.

item.title: The value of targeted advertising
item.description: This post will might be the post that will roast me the most. But before triggering your fingers just by reading the title I would like everyone to read my post, and read my argument before jumping in to conclusions.

item.title: Everyone should get a personal email address
item.description: Recently I sold my old MacBook Pro, and until I buy myself a new laptop, I had to log in to my gmail account from a windows laptop.

item.title: Google launches Question Hub to tackle niche and long tail keyword queries
item.description: You are able to find answers to almost all common questions on Google. But there are some areas where Google fails to provide good answers.

item.title: I just checked Yamu stats, they don’t look good. Is Google killing Yamu?
item.description: Yamu was started out as an idea in a hackathon back in 2011 or 2012 (I can’t remember the exact time), but it’s close to a decade. The original idea was to start something that was close to Uber or PickMe.
